alert.note: Alert for Gila; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 17 at 5:02PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Arizona, including the following counties, in east central Arizona, Gila. In northeast Arizona, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 630 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 502 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding has already happened or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Turkey Canyon and Carrizo Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Carrizo, Cibeque Peak and Fort Apache Reservation. - This includes Highway 60 between mile markers 311 and 317. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
